TopicTitle: [1.6.x] Distant Object Enhancement bis v1.9.1.1 (16 October 2018) - Free to a Good Home

Articles.Content:
Bump...

This is another minor bug-fix release, fixing the problem with ghost flares that show up when flare rendering is supposed to be disabled. On GitHub and KerbalStuff.

I am trying New Horizons mod.

Without more context and information, no. I would need the entire log so I can see what's going on.

It's the same old problem with the DLL Cacteye uses to disable flare rendering when using the telescope. Delete `CactEye/Plugins/DistantObjectHook.dll`-- you'll have to manully turn off flare rendering when looking at planets.

Yeah, I updated kerbalstuff, but I forgot to update this thread. Oops.

This seems to be sort of half working in 1.0.5. The skybox gets dimmed when looking at Kerbin, but not when looking at the sun, which is a bit odd. I'm not using any mod that alters the sun in anyway, except maybe Kopernicus?

[quote name='gerishnakov']This seems to be sort of half working in 1.0.5. The skybox gets dimmed when looking at Kerbin, but not when looking at the sun, which is a bit odd. I'm not using any mod that alters the sun in anyway, except maybe Kopernicus?[/QUOTE]

Stock KSP manages dimming the skybox for the sun, not DOE. If it's not dimming, either you've got a mod that's altering that behavior, or KSP isn't dimming the sun. I checked the basics of this mod when 1.0.5 came out, but I didn't check on stock behavior, so I don't know which case applies.
I tried taking out Kopernicus and now the sun dims properly, so I guess it's a conflict with that then.

What is my known situations "[U]atlas[/U]"? Can I inspect this atlas somehow? Does it refer to some specific data block that should be in my persistence file perhaps?

[quote name='Kaa253']I am finding that this is working correctly for drawing the planets but I am getting no flares for vessels, debris etc. The only thing I see that may be related in the logs is the following...

[I](snip)[/I]

I do have vessels that are orbiting (and also some docked) but I see no flares for them at reasonable distances.
What is my known situations "[U]atlas[/U]"? Can I inspect this atlas somehow? Does it refer to some specific data block that should be in my persistence file perhaps?[/QUOTE]

The atlas is a holdover from the original DOE where you can specify in the config file which vessel conditions would draw flares. Apparently something broke under the hood that I missed with the 1.0.5 update because I don't have enough stuff in orbit to notice missing flares :) . I see the same errors here, so a fix should be easy (maybe as simple as a recompile).

EDIT: Recompiling fixed the problem. Distant Object Enhancement v1.6.4 is now live on GitHub and KerbalStuff. Edited November 21, 2015 by MOARdV
Add update
Brilliant! It is working correctly. Thanks
I get no rendering of ships that are on the ground beyond 8,5-10km range, for some reason.

[quote name='Corovaneer']I get no rendering of ships that are on the ground beyond 8,5-10km range, for some reason.[/QUOTE]

Flares are not generated for landed (or splashed or pre-launch) vessels. You can change that locally if you like by editing DistantObject/Settings.cfg. Find the line that reads 'situations' and change it to:

[code]
situations = ORBITING,SUB_ORBITAL,ESCAPING,DOCKED,LANDED,SPLASHED,PRELAUNCH,FLYING
[/code]

and all vessels and debris flares will be rendered (when visible), regardless of their state.
Thanks, that worked! Very helpful with BDArmory!

Is there any way to make the skybox dimming more sensitive? I would love to be able to have the skybox dimmed even when doing something like looking at a lit up ship. (I'm not afraid of opening up monodevelop if need be)
